head.title: COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease) – Health Services – Hereford ISD

svg.metadata: Created by potrace 1.15, written by Peter Selinger 2001-2017

div.span: The safety of our students and staff is our first priority, and we will continue to monitor COVID-19 developments, collaborate with other county entities, and follow the guidance of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Texas State Department of Health Services. While we utilize a variety of methods to share updates with parents and staff, this page is a resource for the latest information on COVID-19 as it relates to Hereford ISD.

p.strong: School Schedules: Hereford ISD schools, offices and facilities will be closed to the general public through the end of the school year. We will continue alternative learning opportunities for our students through May 21, 2020.

div.p: Food Service: Hereford ISD will be serving Free Grab n Go meals for any student from 1 to 18 years of age at the following locations. This will be a drive thru pick up from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Monday - Friday until at least May 21, 2020.
Hereford High School Cafeteria 200 Ave F
Hereford Preparatory Academy and Hereford Junior High 704 La Plata Dr
Tierra Blanca Early Childhood Center 615 Columbia
Blue Water Garden Apartments 612 N Irving St

strong.span: For more information and answers to frequently asked questions, please click on the links below or to the right of this page:

div.div: The Masonic Children and Family Services of Texas may be able to help your family during this time. See the document below for more information and an application. If you need help with the application or have questions, please email your campus counselor or principal.

a.span: Bacterial Meningitis Information for Students and Parents

div.p: Hereford Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, or disability in providing education services, activities, and programs, including vocational programs, in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Educational Amendments of 1972; and section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
